website_summaries.verdict: The Zyxel PLA5236KIT is an affordable yet effective choice for those looking to extend their home network for internet sharing.
pros: The Zyxel PLA5236KIT can easily extend a home network without you having to run network cables
cons: The messy web interface makes the setup process challenging for home users
The kit has slow performance and, as a powerline product, requires certain conditions to work well

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Networking Ever
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. This has to be the easiest networking experience I've ever had. Large-footprint house with modem/router in one corner, wanted better reception elsewhere. Had a Netgear Powerline system and a WiFi router acting as access-point that just stopped working for reasons unknown -- plug in sender, flashed on, then died. Got this thinking I could remove the 2nd router kludged to act as an access point since it has wireless at the receiving end. Yep. Plugged in unit at the router/modem end, plugged in cable. Went downstairs and plugged in the receiver/WiFi. Launched the app, renamed the network, done. Figured it'd take an hour or so to do it all, done in 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: D.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Wired connection is good, wi-fi connection is very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The wired connection is fast and stable (watching YouTube on smart TVs work with zero stutter or drop outs), so I know it's not a problem with the house wiring. The wi-fi connection on the same house power wiring (even the same outlets) is extremely frustrating. Both Skype connections and attempting to watch YouTube on the same smart TV is unusable, even when 10 feet or less from the wi-fi access point. Not recommended, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: FL Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I recommend using any of the zyxel powerline products. This one in particular is nice because you are able to create a remote WiFi network if the area shares an electrical connection with the main building that houses your router- in my case a studio space in a garage on the back of our lot. This solved many problems that result from MacBooks without Ethernet ports etc( or any ports for that matter). We are also able to stream movies on the tv without a direct connection. Inexpensive and easy to setup with a smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing speed
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on two floors in my house, both lower than my router floor. I stream television via Roku and had to re-connect my Roku wirelessly to my upstairs router instead of this unit, because the speeds are too slow, causes choppy pictures. Zyxel signal shows as stronger, which is expected since it is closer to the Roku, but the speed is noticeably slower.
customer_reviews.author: Bmaca5

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and gave me internet out in my pole barn. Just took a little creative wiring to make sure both units were on the same circuit and it's still a little weak because of the distance, about 300 feet. Speed in the barn is slow, but our service at the house is crap to begin with so I'm happy I got it to work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Randy from the U-P

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy, just used the app. Plugged the base unit in with the ethernet from the router - Plugged in the one with the antenna's behind the entertainment center (on the other end of the house) and ran an ethernet to the Home Theater system - we now stream HDX video like a champ. Laptops and smartphones also test at near 100 Mbs in the Living Room or Kitchen, just like near the router.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Best to connect directly to wall outlet
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as advertised. I tried multiple outlets and discovered that the transmitter doesn't work if you are using an UPS. Mine has a line filter so it was probably disrupting the signal. Best to connect directly to wall outlet. My house house has two panels, so I had to try different outlets to find the best combination. Download speeds were within 90% of non-powerline signals. Would have given 5 stars but the instructions are horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, peasy setup and great performance
customer_reviews.text: Within 5 minutes of unboxing and installing in two outlets spread across my home, we had a solid Ethernet connection. After a few more minutes configuring the WiFi setup using the Android app, the wireless speed at the far end clocked in at 65Mb using 2.4GHz, and 80Mb using 5GHz. The app is reporting an Ethernet speed of 485Mb. Not too shabby for old house wiring. The kit arrived nicely packaged too.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Dabkowski

customer_reviews.title: it is a good solution for hone cabling if you don't want extra ...
customer_reviews.text: it is a good solution for hone cabling if you don't want extra work. speed is vary dependent on the networking. it is good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Within the same building would be great.
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well, with my garage doors open to a metal building, doors closed makes things difficult to receive signal from house, had to set up a different system.
customer_reviews.author: clifton fruge jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup. For very long distance powerline look further.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. Didn’t add any further powerline distance as compared to first generation powerline (this is what I was hoping for).
customer_reviews.author: wownstuff

customer_reviews.title: Less than specified
customer_reviews.text: Wired or wireless does not go above 80mbps subscribed to 200mbps. Wifi reception is down to 2 bars less than 15 ft away from powerline wifi. Personal router receiving 180mbps with full bars at same distance to powerline wifi.
customer_reviews.author: RichardF Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: This works great with no lost connections
customer_reviews.text: This works great with no lost connections. The last one would drop out at night and then found it was my porch light turning on at dusk would interfere with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: high speed Internet to my garage - EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Incredible product. Simplest installation for this type of product. It works better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: just a consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works but not compatible w own products
customer_reviews.text: Isn't compatible with other zyxel pla products with the home link AV standard
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works I guess :-/
customer_reviews.text: The pla5236 works but I only get a 10th the original speed (20 of 200 Mbps). The pla5206v2 doesn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ultimately it provides super fast WIFI for a part of my house on ...
customer_reviews.text: Though setup was a little wonky, the app doesn't work for this pair of devices, ultimately it provides super fast WIFI for a part of my house on a different floor from router. Faster in fact than what I pay for from FIOS.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Slow to open website.
customer_reviews.text: I notice a delay when visiting websites. Although I have good signal it definitely takes longer for my device to be directed to the chosen website vs using my network wifi connection which is connected directly to my cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 boys

customer_reviews.title: This only works if you have good wireing in your home. I bought a much cheaper one to test it first.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and not hard to install. I just have two wifi signals one works only on the top floor top floor and one only works on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: andrew boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great extender
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Help with a signal loss on direct a WiFi due to several walls.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkdoc5477

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product Mar 2018. Stopped working June 2018. Can not reach seller: Milton & Ashley Co. and return and support window passed. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works my existing Zyxel boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Great solution to getting wifi to the back of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great connection speed. Highly recommend for anyone with Wifi deadspots in their house.
customer_reviews.author: moises palomera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed, does what it said. Easy setup using the app, very stable. WiFi in my detatched garage. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have tried another powerline extender and wasn't happy with the performance.The ZYXEL worked right out of the box plug in and go works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: frustrating and finicky wireless solution
customer_reviews.text: I can't make this work. The last Zyxel system i bought solved my problem of needing ethernet for my TV. This unit is supposed to provide a wireless signal in the master bedroom. it would not pair after trying multiple outlets. sits on my desk waiting for resolution. can i return it?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Slater

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi experience
customer_reviews.text: Setup is very easy. Wifi speed is anywhere from 35-135 Mbps when 10 ft from unit (line of sight). However, I have this mounted inside of my garage hoping for good wifi around my garage, in my yard and patio area. I was disappointed in wifi distance, about 50 ft, with garage doors open but very poor wifi through exterior brick walls (I.e., no wifi or weak signal outside of garage).
customer_reviews.author: Walt65

customer_reviews.title: Carrier pidgens would be faster
customer_reviews.text: After installing this I found that throughput was even slower. After digging very deep into the device's web interface I see this for the powerline interface: Transmit Rate(Mbps): 43 Receive Rate(Mbps): 148 They advertise as 1gig but can't even do 1/20th of that rate.
customer_reviews.author: T&M
